conclusion: Analyze the provided diagram of acceleration versus time.
Object A has a constant acceleration a_A.
Object B has a linearly increasing acceleration, a_B(t) = kt.
Velocity v(t) is obtained by integrating acceleration a(t) with respect to time t.
Velocity of Object A: v_A(t) = a_A t.
Evaluate velocities at t_1: v_A(t_1) = a_A t_1 and v_B(t_1) = (1/2)k t_1^2.
Determine if velocities are equal at t_1: a_A t_1 = (1/2)k t_1^2.
If 2a_A = k t_1, then velocities are equal at t_1.
Area under the curve for both A and B from 0 to t_1 indicates they are equal.
Final conclusion: At time t_1, the two objects have the same velocity.
